summary.p: Apologizes for not yet being able to copy and send an epistle requested by Bullinger, and promises to do so at the next opportunity.

div.p: Grace and peace from the Lord.

The inconvenience of the messenger and the constant demands of my work were the reasons I did not send the letter you requested. However, with the next messenger, I wish to fulfill your request with a rather lengthy letter, which requires effort to transcribe. But as I promise, I will deliver.
Farewell in the Lord and continue to regard Gervasius with your former zeal.
Given on the twenty-first of February in the year 1532.
Give my heartfelt greetings to your wife, my faithful companion in tribulation.
To the clearly learned and pious man Heinrich Bullinger, to be observed with utmost respect.
